title: What would make a police officer believe that he has any say in where my family lives? - Quora
tags: Jobs and Careers in Police and Law Enforcement

response.answer_text: I once talked to a homeless guy living under an underpass on public property and when I suggested he shouldn’t be living there, he said he had the right to live wherever the hell he wanted. I take it you believe that’s true? That I can go live on the front walk to your house? That I can live in your backyard? That I can squat in your house while you are away on vacation without permission? I’d say there are many cases where a cop can think he can tell you that you can’t live somewhere.

This day and age, they don't have a say in where you live. However, in the days of the wild west and during the days of early law enforcement, they would tell you to get out of town. Most criminals complied. But that was many, many years ago.
